hero.title: A new way to image the planet
hero.subtitle: Discover Blue Planet Revolution

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.subtitle: A 'Living Planet' Virtual Earth 'SuperMarket'
vision.textTwo: A never proposed concept by which fresh space images are treated as any other commercial 'fresh goods' able to be ordered and obtained in matter of a few clicks.
vision.textFour: V-GLOBE provides a lightning fast, cost-effective way to view the entire planet from above.
vision.textFive: We are committed to making Earth observation accessible, affordable, and easy to use for everyone, from governments and NGOs to businesses and individuals.
vision.textSix: Our technology enables real-time access to high-quality satellite imagery, empowering users to make informed decisions and take action based on the most up-to-date information available.

members.name: Jean-Pierre Antikidis
members.description: Former head of Space System Information at CNES and international expert in Space Data management

experience.item: Managed ground systems projects for Pakistan, Africa, and Asia, and spent 8 years at the European Space Agency.
Responsible at CNES for concepts of future ground systems and French delegate in scientific and technical advisory groups.
Inventor of advanced computing technologies, part of the initial group that conceived what is now known as the Cloud.

members.currentRole: President and CEO of Blue Planet. Leads the technical development of the v-GLOBE program since 2009, focusing on space sensors, telecommunications, and Cloud systems.

members.name: Patrice Brudieu
members.description: Former Deputy Director at CNES and adviser at the French Ministry of Space Policy.

experience.item: Worked at CNES as a system engineer in Earth observation satellites, and later Deputy Director in charge of program management, valorization, and defense affairs.
Held key responsibilities at the European Space Agency (ESA) within the manned flight program.
Led the ministerial department responsible for the French Space Policy for six years, gaining high-level strategic insight into European and French space organizations.
Advisor to Blue Planet on technical, managerial, and funding strategies for EO-based programs and satellite infrastructure.

members.currentRole: Senior project adviser to Blue Planet, supporting strategic development and partnerships in the European space ecosystem.

members.name: Bernard Plano
members.description: Senior aerospace and defense executive, former CEO of Matra Systems & Information, and international business strategist

experience.item: Electrical engineer with an MBA from HEC Business School.
Joined Matra/EADS in the late 1980s, specialized in data systems for defense; led Matra Systems & Information as Chairman & CEO (1996–2004).
Executive VP of International Business Development at EADS, with responsibility for defense and space systems in over 50 countries.
Founded Plano BP Consulting and led strategic international development at Spacebel, a leader in European space information systems.
Oversaw major European space programs like Ariane, SPOT, Helios, and Hipparcos.

members.currentRole: Industrial team manager at Blue Planet since 2012, guiding team management and supplier networks, and supporting the company’s strategic and financial evolution.

members.name: Michel Courtois
members.role: CTO – Head of Space Segment Engineering
members.description: Former Director at ESA/ESTEC and SPOT satellite program lead engineer at CNES

experience.item: Graduated from École Polytechnique and ENSAE in 1971 as an aerospace engineer.
Led the development of the French Earth Observation SPOT satellite at CNES, launched in 1986, laying the foundation for European commercial EO programs.
Held leadership roles at CNES including Deputy Director for applications and Director of the Toulouse Space Center.
Appointed CTO and Vice President of Alcatel Space, managing over 1500 engineers in charge of technical development and quality.
Served as Director of Technical and Quality Management at ESA and Head of ESTEC (2004–2010).
Recipient of numerous awards, including the Legion of Honour (2000), National Order of Merit (1991), and the Grand Prix of ANAE (1987).

members.currentRole: President of the Van Allen Foundation and CTO of Blue Planet for the v-GLOBE space segment, overseeing quality and technical performance.

product.title: Our Technology
product.subtitle: A never experienced technical revolution with satellites directly plugged onto a Cloud bringing a new level of simplicity and economical efficiency

features.title: Blue Planet is a Big Data Provider
features.description1: No need to contact satellite operators
features.description3: Access imagery directly from the Blue Planet data store
features.description4: Browse, select, and download the data you need at any time
features.description5: Instant access to high-quality satellite data

features.title: v-GLOBE: Global Coverage Reimagined
features.description1: Virtual replica of Earth, refreshed weekly
features.description2: No need for custom tasking or requests
features.description3: High-res access to any location – even oceans
features.description4: Powered by proprietary space + ground tech

section1.title: A striking evolution and simplification of Earth observation data handling and processing
section1.description2: offer making use of the most advanced Internet/Cloud technology
section1.description3: low-cost and massive production business model.

section2.title: Global Coverage Reinvented
section2.description: v-GLOBE delivers a high-resolution, weekly-refreshed digital replica of Earth – instantly available without satellite scheduling or programming.
section2.description1: A complete, refreshed image of the entire planet, including oceans.
section2.description2: No requests, no delays – imagery is available anytime, directly from the cloud.
section2.description3: High detail, 4 spectral channels, and real-time usability.

section3.title: v-GLOBE: Planet-Scale Imaging, Simplified
section3.description: Why wait for satellite tasking? v-GLOBE flips the script: the entire planet is scanned continuously by 12 low-cost satellites, processed onboard, and streamed directly to the Cloud.
section3.description1: Weekly refresh of the full Earth, oceans included.
section3.description2: Images processed in space, streamed directly to internet-ready format.
section3.description3: Cost per km² drops by a factor of 3–4 thanks to full automation.
section3.description4: Infrastructure ready for seamless machine-to-machine services.

cards.title:

Image Quality
cards.description: Sub-meter resolution (up to 75 cm), 4-channel colors, including near-infrared, with data freshness under 42 hours.

cards.title: Global Accessibility
cards.description: They are proceseed on-board satellites and stored in the cloud where you can simply access them.

cards.title:
Pricing
Reduced ×4
cards.description: Cost ranges from a maximum of 2$/km² down to 0.1$/km² for large areas, or even as low as 0.01$km² for a full continent.

cards.title: Highly confortable access
cards.description: You just have to make your market in the Blue Planet data store, as simply as going to the internet.

excellency.title: How Blue Planet Generates Value
excellency.subtitle: Satellite Earth Observation illustrated by the v-GLOBE Big Data project is an absolutely essential tool for generating information and monitoring our progress at all geographic scales as we explore new development pathways aimed at sustainable management of the planet, tackling disaster risk reduction, climate change, and sustainable development in an integrated way.

services.title: Defence, Intelligence
features: Produce and quickly distribute geographic information (Maps, databases ...) and Intelligence, an area national or international interest
Prepare, simulate and evaluate projects in conditions of reality
Guiding aircraft, missiles and drones according to space-born information
Ensure consistent geographic data from different sources: information, topographic mapping, ...
Repeated monitoring of places of interest
Analyse terrorist thread by systematic search of pre-identified pattern of interest
Intelligence search covering continents
services.text: The use of the full planet at metric resolution is a terrific BIG DATA set that contains invisible but high value Intelligence potential. The information of interest is often at place where no-one looks and the value a full Planet set as produced systematically by v-GLOBE could generate a large interest. Impact of v-GLOBE thank to its FULL cover in any circumstance may becomes quite strong (and profitable). Ensure the sovereignty and independence of a country in terms of information territorial in times of crisis and in times of peace, in particular:

services.title: Cartography and Cadastre
services.description: The use of satellite imagery for map creation is very common today. Clients opt for higher-resolution images while also requesting price reductions.
features: Topographic maps
Land use analysis
Terrain change monitoring
services.text: V-Globe products will allows to reate or update topographic maps, databases and cartographic representation at any scale 1:5000 and above; Optimise campaigns of field surveys. Create or update a Topographic background comprehensive and geographically continuous cadastral plans; Use a map or cadastral information system as Map Update tool or land management service; Orthoimagery for the production of topographic maps in raster or vector form; Creation of Fragmented databases: visible parcel boundaries, limits cadastral parcel, and descriptive databases associated (Land, tax, land register ...)

services.title: Precision Agriculture
services.description: Precision agriculture exemplifies the successful application of Earth observation from space. Data cost per square kilometer is a determining factor. Satellite imagery helps implement sustainable agricultural management practices while ensuring the preservation of soil, land, and water resources.
features: Producing vegetation and surface production estimators and inputs to production aid management
Monitoring the state of cultivated areas: Annual culture, vineyards, olive groves ...
Managing agricultural practices at the plot (precision farming)
Making inventories and crop forecasting (Annual crops, plantations, illegal crops)
Preparing the assessment of harvest needs
Monitoring water irrigation and assess the impact of bad weather
Control and monitor agri-environmental measures and public aids
services.text: statisticsAgriculture is one of the first demonstration of sucesfull applications of Earth observation by space. Mapping the changing distribution of croplands, advancing the accuracy of measurements of biomass and improving forecasts of shortfalls in crop production is becoming a must. Space imagery will help implementing sustainable agricultural management practices while assuring the preservation of soil, land and water resources. Value Added Companies (VACs) making use of v-GLOBE imagery are mostly :

services.title: Supply Chain Verification
services.description: Forest management is fundamental to monitoring global climate evolution. Moreover, it is a key indicator of the impact of human activities on our natural environment. V-Globe is an ideal provider for applications requiring rapid, large-scale coverage.
features: Awareness of the forest areas and settlements
Planning of cuts, delimitation and monitoring plots
Biomass estimate
Monitoring plant health
Monitoring of plantations (illegal plants or cuts)
Estimate of weather damage: fires, storms, hurricanes ...
Protection of specific areas against wild human or disease aggressions (eg. natural parks protection or urban extensions control)
Creation and updating forest databases
Aid in the identification and monitoring of forest fires systems of deforestation / reforestation
services.text: Forestry management is quite essential to the world climate evolution monitoring. This is also a strong indicator of the impact of human activities onto our natural environment. That require both massive and frequent cover of large surface while in the mean time a very high resolution to detect early enough the biotop first sign of aggressions. Major Forest application of space imagery data covers:

services.title: Fisheries Resources
services.description: Remote sensing of ocean properties provides critical information for ecosystem governance at global and regional scales. Thanks to its total-Earth coverage and spectral observation capability, V-Globe can support fisheries management through ocean color monitoring.
features: Identification of fishing areas and estimates of their attendance
Utilisation of pictures for detection of boats and characterisation of fishing practices
Fight against illegal fishing to ensure compliance with legislation
Coastal zone pollution detection helping a sustainable management of fisheries
services.text: Remote sensing of ocean properties provides us with a window into the ocean ecosystem on synoptic scales. Various environmental properties influence fish distribution, abundance, and migration can be assessed thanks to remote sensing sensors. For example Chlorophyll concentrations provides an indication of phytoplankton concentrations in the surface layer of the ocean. Marine phytoplankton plays a key role in the marine food chain, and is also an indicator of changes in the ocean environment due to pollution or shifts in the global climate system. Can be obtained:

services.title: Wildlife and Natural Landscape Preservation
services.description: Information collected from space enables reliable, consistent monitoring by combining it with other digital data to create dynamic maps, images, and graphics for research or to guide wildlife management. Satellites with rapid revisit cycles, like V-Globe, are ideal for repetitive image generation and natural change monitoring.
features: Track change detection to protecting and monitor natural landscapes aggressions
Make survey of human habitat expansion in protected areas
Analyse environmental features able to impact on some species development
Monitor changes occurring in habitats zones and project the impact on wildlife species at risk.
services.text: Wildlife habitats are under increasing pressure and monitoring and law enforcement methods must adapt to these changes even in the most isolated places. Information collected from space supports reliable and consistent monitoring when combined with other digital data can be used to create dynamic maps, images and charts, which can be used in research, or to guide wildlife management. Can be mentionned the possibility to:

services.title: Oil, Gas, Minerals, Groundwater, Hydraulic Energy
services.description: In the offshore oil and gas sector, building production platforms capable of withstanding severe weather conditions is becoming essential.
services.alt: Oil, Gas, Minerals, Groundwater, Hydraulic Energy
features: Update the geological information of a prospecting area
Explore oil resources and gas onshore and offshore
Pipeline Corridor Monitoring
Conduct infrastructure development (plots, pipeline ...)
Ensure environmental impact monitoring and control of operating infrastructure
Monitor of environmental impacts of onshore or offshore operations
Evaluate snow cover and derive melted water potential
services.text: Worldwide offshore resource-based operations such as oil and gas exploration and production have intensified over the past few decades. In the offshore oil and gas sector, the cost of building production platforms capable of withstanding severe weather conditions is becoming a must.

services.title: Civil Engineering and Urban Construction Management
services.description: Satellite remote sensing data has been successfully used for mapping, monitoring, planning, and developing urban expansion, land use, and the urban environment. It can also assess traffic, real-estate and tourism offerings, as well as the growth of informal settlements on vacant land and urban land-use zoning in many developing countries.
services.alt: Civil Engineering and Urban Construction Management
features: The planning of new roads
The verification of buildings creation or extensions
The evaluation of building damages
The tracking of urban population development
The verification conformity for constructions appearing in a remote situation without prior warning
services.text: Over the years, satellite-based remote sensing data have been successfully utilised for mapping, monitoring, planning and development of urban sprawl, urban land use and urban environment. Thank to v-Globe continuously refreshed imagery it is now be possible to monitor and manage the development of urban housing, infrastructure, transportation means. Can also be performed the evaluation of traffic profiles, real estates and tourism offers. Can be easily addressed with the v-GLOBE imagery information:

services.title: Early Warning
services.description: Prediction of floods, wildfires, and disease outbreaks. Satellite remote sensing provides a comprehensive view of climate patterns, soil temperature, and other environmental factors that help forecast extreme events. This information is crucial for disaster planning and response.
features: Global, continuous temporal coverage via satellite constellations
Automated data processing with anomaly detection
Multisensor integration (optical, radar, radiometric) for greater reliability
Timely communication with alerts scalable to the level of risk
services.text: Early warning through Earth Observation involves continuous monitoring of critical environmental variables—such as soil moisture, gas concentrations, vegetation cover and water levels—to detect early signals of potential natural disasters. This method not only improves the accuracy of forecasts for wildfires, droughts, floods and landslides, but also optimizes how resources are allocated for risk reduction. Integrating meteorological, geochemical and topographic data enables early warning systems to help local authorities and civil‐protection agencies anticipate extreme events, plan evacuations and reinforce critical infrastructure in advance.

services.title: Post-Event Analysis
services.description: Post-event analysis uses satellite imagery to assess the impact of natural events such as earthquakes, floods, and hurricanes. These images help authorities understand damage extent, plan recovery efforts, and coordinate relief operations.
features: Damage assessment
Recovery planning
Aid coordination
services.text: Post-event analysis uses satellite imagery to assess the impact of natural events such as earthquakes, floods, and hurricanes. These images help authorities understand damage extent, plan recovery efforts, and coordinate relief operations. Provides near real-time updates on changes (or damage) to structures, land and vegetation, allowing for a more cost-effective response.

about.name: The Company
about.title: Blue Planet vision derives from concepts developed by CNES, INRIA and Orange Labs
about.subtitle: The company was founded in 2009 by Jean-Pierre Antikidis, former head of Space System Information at CNES and data management international expert, Jean Jacques Favier, former NASA STS78 Astronaut and Director of innovation at CNES, presently professor and Chair of Research Steering Committee at the International Space University.

footer.description: Blue Planet commercializes fresh and high value « near defence » submeter color imagery of our planet, any time, any place, and at bottom prices.
